Localisation.report_string:
--- Localisation ---
Agree with lesion involving:
- right midbrain.
  
Additional signs indicate potential further lesion in:
- right optic nerve (cranial nerve II).

Differential diagnosis.report_string:
--- Differential diagnosis ---
Correctly included: Multiple sclerosis
  
These suggested differentials are reasonable:

- Right paramedian midbrain infarction (PCA perforator; Weber/Benedikt spectrum); Midbrain hemorrhage or cavernous malformation; Posterior communicating artery aneurysm causing compressive third nerve palsy; Intrinsic midbrain tumor (glioma)

ft_diagnoses_raw: Right paramedian midbrain infarction (PCA perforator; Weber/Benedikt spectrum)
Posterior communicating artery aneurysm causing compressive third nerve palsy
additional_diagnoses: Right paramedian midbrain infarction (PCA perforator; Weber/Benedikt spectrum)
Posterior communicating artery aneurysm causing compressive third nerve palsy

Investigations.report_string:
--- Investigations ---

- Agree with MRI including the Brain - would potetially inform a diagnosis/details of multiple sclerosis.

- But incomplete, should also consider: MRI Orbits and CSF test for Oligoclonal Bands.

ft_proposed_investigations: CT Angiogram of Head and Neck
MRI Brain with diffusion- and susceptibility-weighted sequences
MR Angiography of Head and Neck
Transthoracic echocardiogram (with bubble study if cryptogenic)
Comprehensive ophthalmic assessment including visual fields and dilated fundus examination
Digital subtraction angiography (if aneurysm suspected or for endovascular therapy)

Management.report_string:
--- Management ---
Steroids: Inappropriate omission. The plan failed to consider this possible treatment option.
  
Additional factors not mentioned:

- Presenting complaint is not specified, so no indication whether this is related to MS.

- Timing of current symptoms not specified, so no indication whether this is a recent issue or old deficit.

- Need to know comorbidities to ensure no contraindications to immunosuppression.

DMTs: Inappropriate omission. The plan failed to consider this possible treatment option.
  
Additional factors not mentioned:

- Need confirmation of MS diagnosis.

- Need to know comorbidities to ensure no contraindications to immunosuppression.

reasons: If CT angiography shows basilar or proximal PCA occlusion
Eligible by imaging/time criteria (up to 24 hours)
If thrombolysis given, start after 24 hours and repeat imaging excludes haemorrhage
If thrombolysis not given, start once haemorrhage excluded on initial imaging
Secondary prevention after ischaemic stroke suspected
Safe to start once swallowing assessed

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Blood pressure optimisation per stroke protocol
reasons: Maintain permissive hypertension unless exceeding thresholds
Reduces risk of extension or haemorrhagic transformation

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Intermittent pneumatic compression for DVT prophylaxis
reasons: Immobility with hemiparesis increases VTE risk

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Endovascular treatment of posterior communicating artery aneurysm (coiling/clipping)
reasons: Proceed if CTA/MRA confirms aneurysm causing pupil-involving III palsy

ft_full_plan_parsed.treatment: Eye care for ophthalmoplegia (lubrication, occlusion for diplopia)
Early multidisciplinary stroke rehabilitation (physiotherapy, OT, speech/swallow)
reasons: Addresses gait ataxia and left-sided spastic weakness

missing_information: Presenting complaint is not specified, so no indication whether this is related to MS.
Timing of current symptoms not specified, so no indication whether this is a recent issue or old deficit.
A safety screen for patient-specific comorbidities is required to identify contraindications to immunosuppressive therapy.
